Key Match Events: Cleveland outscored OKC 23-15 in the final 9:05 while holding the Thunder scoreless for the final two minutes
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander led the Thunder with a game-high 31 points, while Jalen Williams added 25
Jarrett Allen led the way for the Cavs with 25 points, 11 rebounds, six assists and three steals
Evan Mobley added 21 points, 10 boards and seven dimes
Donovan Mitchell’s two-handed hammer right before the half put them up 62-59 at the break
Cleveland went on a 8-0 spurt to take control in the 4th quarter
Cleveland outscoring the Thunder 13-6 in the final 2 minutes to seal the win
Pre-Game Insights: It was Cleveland’s 11th straight victory, improving its NBA-best record to 32-4 while snapping OKC’s franchise-record win streak at 15 games
The 2024-25 Cavs now join the elite group of teams to reach a 32-4 start, becoming just the seventh team in history to do so
With Donovan Mitchell limited to just 11 points, the Cavs relied on their entire lineup to step up
Post-Match Reflections: It was just pure basketball according to Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson
Jarrett Allen said, 'It felt like a battle the whole night'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 30 lead changes were the second-most in a game this season
Down 107-106, Cleveland went on a 8-0 spurt to take control
The Cavs grabbed the final five rebounds of the game, including three offensive boards to bleed the clock to triple zeroes
